nodes.text: The Bestiary of Darth Caldoth was a book written by Darth Caldoth, a Dark Lord of the Sith. The title was a compendium of Sith warbeasts and their attributes. The Bestiary was eventually acquired by the Jedi Order and a fragment of it came into the possession of Jedi Initiates Dooku and Sifo-Dyas after being secretly given to them by Jedi Master Lene Kostana.

The Bestiary of Darth Caldoth was a compendium of Sith warbeasts and their attributes that was authored by the eponymous Darth Caldoth, a Dark Lord of the Sith. The book collected information on the silooth, tuk'ata, veergundark, krastenane, and other creatures.

Darth Caldoth wrote the Bestiary at least a millennium before 87 BBY. At some point prior to that year, the Jedi Order came into possession of the title. While in the Jedi's possession, the book was stored within the Jedi Archives of the Jedi Temple on the planet Coruscant.

At some point after its acquisition by the Jedi Order, Jedi Master Lene Kostana acquired the title from the Jedi Archives. Later, in 87 BBY, during a conversation with Jedi Initiates Sifo-Dyas and Dooku, Kostana snuck a fragment of the book into a pile of papers from the Lothal Papyri which the two Initiates were deciphering. After reading the fragment, Dooku was alarmed and intended to report Kostana and turn the fragment in. However, Sifo-Dyas convinced him not to.

Because she gave the book to him, Dooku began to suspect that Lene Kostana was secretly a Sith. Dooku confronted Kostana about the Bestiary on the contemplation balcony, a meditation spot on the Temple Spire of the Jedi Temple. The confrontation turned into a duel but was swiftly resolved by Jedi Grand Master Yoda.

After Yoda's intervention, it was revealed that Kostana was not a Sith and had given Dooku and Sifo-Dyas the book fragment in the hope that it would unearth repressed memories within Dooku. Several days prior, Dooku experienced a vision when he and Sifo-Dyas broke into the Bogan Collection, a hidden vault of dark side artifacts inside the Jedi Archives. Dooku could not recall the details of the vision, and Kostana wished to learn more. Yoda demonstrated frustration with Kostana over her tactics and requested that she return the rest of the Bestiary to the Jedi Archives.
The Bestiary of Darth Caldoth appeared in a flashback in Dooku: Jedi Lost, a 2019 audio drama by Cavan Scott.
